overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students interpret the definitions of discontinuous graph and step function through examination of graphs. They are given a context and must provide both the piecewise function and the graph that models it, explaining why it is a step function. Next, they analyze the greatest integer function (floor function) and least integer function (ceiling function).

overview_item_data_items: I can write and graph step functions from problem situations.
I can interpret the graph and function notation representing step functions.
I can use technology to graph a step function.
A discontinuous graph is continuous for some domain values, with at least one disjoint area between consecutive x-values.
A step function is a piecewise function on a given interval whose pieces are discontinuous constant functions.

The greatest integer function, also known as the floor function, is a special type of step function. The greatest integer function <math><mi>G</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></math> is defined as the greatest integer less than or equal to <math><mi>x</mi></math>.

The least integer function, also known as the ceiling function, is a special type of step function. The least integer function <math><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></math> is defined as the least integer greater than or equal to <math><mi>x</mi></math>.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze the graph of a piecewise function from a given situation.
Students investigate a situation to learn about discontinuous graphs and step functions.
Students explain how they determine whether a situation, function, or graph is a step function.
Students explore the greatest integer function (floor function) and least integer function (ceiling function).

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students identify connections between discontinuous, piecewise, and step functions.
